BriefDescription: This event counts a subset of the Topdown Slots event that were no operation was delivered to the back-end pipeline due to instruction fetch limitations when the back-end could have accepted more operations. Common examples include instruction cache misses or x86 instruction decode limitations.
PublicDescription:
This event counts a subset of the Topdown Slots event that were no operation was delivered to the back-end pipeline due to instruction fetch limitations when the back-end could have accepted more operations. Common examples include instruction cache misses or x86 instruction decode limitations.
The count may be distributed among unhalted logical processors (hyper-threads) who share the same physical core, in processors that support Intel Hyper-Threading Technology. Software can use this event as the numerator for the Frontend Bound metric (or top-level category) of the Top-down Microarchitecture Analysis method.
